intro: Microseris indivisa, commonly known as the narrowleaf biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Microseris indivisa is a perennial species that is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
